stadium.name: The Unruly Yard
stadium.description: A field in the center of the city's most rebellious district. The stadium is covered in graffiti, the crowd is hostile, and riots are a common post-game (and mid-game) event.

stats.pregame_ritual: Drinking a shot of hot gravy from a dented tin cup.
Arranging their gear in a perfect, aesthetically pleasing spiral.
Testing the heft of their weapon with a series of slow, deliberate swings.
Kissing the Trollball on its stitched 'nose'.
Reviewing hand signals for secret plays.
Refusing to step on any lines on the field before the whistle blows.
Telling a terrible joke to the Trollball to 'loosen it up'.
Dipping their hands in a bucket of ice-cold well water.
Slapping their own helmet until their ears ring.
Singing a sea shanty completely out of tune.
Reciting a short, epic poem about a past victory.

stadium.name: Fletchings Field
stadium.description: Fletchings Field was the first formal Troll Ball stadium in Warden lands. The design balances wood and stone, with arrowhead motifs and banners representing each region under Warden protection. The field includes trees, gully's and other obstacle placements, changed each match by local druids and terrain crafters.

stats.pregame_ritual: Going over the game plan drawn in the dirt with the team captain.
Leading the team in a synchronized chant that slowly gets louder.
Wearing their boots on the wrong feet during the warm-up.
Wearing their boots on the wrong feet during the warm-up.
Giving the Trollball a heroic backstory before each game.
Headbutting their own team's goal post (gently).
Sticking a specific type of feather in their helmet's plume.
Burying their helmet in the ground and then digging it back up.
Reading their own fortune in a scattering of knuckle bones.
Wearing a specific, garishly colored pair of undergarments.
Always putting on their left gauntlet before their right.

preGame:
# ‚öæ GREETINGS AND SALUTATIONS, OSTERRA! ‚öæ

Nok the Corrupter here, coming to you live from the most wonderfully dilapidated spot in New Monteforte‚Äî**The Unruly Yard**! We are at the precipice of destiny, folks! This is Game Four of the Grand Finals, and the Chaos Creatures are sitting pretty with a 2-1 lead in the series! If those Monteforte miscreants pull off a win tonight, they‚Äôll force a bracket reset against the top-seeded Oak & Onslaught! The air is thick with the scent of rebellion, spray paint, and the faint, delightful aroma of impending fractures! üèüÔ∏è

I‚Äôve been watching the pre-game festivities, and let me tell you, the Warden favorites are looking... well, peculiar! **Wynnie Faina** and **Normi Glaudia** are out there with their boots on the wrong feet again. They call it a ritual; I call it a disaster waiting to happen on this unstable scaffolding! Meanwhile, **Millham Evangeline** is carefully tucking a feather into their helmet, probably hoping it‚Äôll act as a lucky charm when a broadsword comes swinging! ü™∂

Over in the Chaos camp, they aren‚Äôt messing around! **Lian Denton** just downed a shot of hot gravy that looked thick enough to patch a hole in a shield! **Raouf Dragone** is currently reciting an epic poem about past victories, likely trying to distract himself from the fact that the crowd is currently throwing half-eaten sausages at the **Sir Randy** posters! The fans are rowdy, the scaffolding is swaying like a drunken sailor, and I‚Äôm pretty sure I saw **Falric** trying to bet a bag of shiny rocks on a total wipeout! üç∫

Will the "heroes" of Oak & Onslaught find their footing, or will the Chaos Creatures send them packing? The open bar is officially open, the players are hydrated with questionable fluids, and my demonic heart is ready for some beautiful, chaotic Trollball! Let‚Äôs get it on! üî•üèà
postGame:
# üèÜ THE OAK STANDS FIRM! WE HAVE A SERIES TIE! üèÜ

By the scorched pits of the Demon Prison, what a defensive masterclass! If you came here looking for a Monteforte coronation, you‚Äôre going home disappointed, but if you came for a symphony of shattered hopes and bruised kidneys, you‚Äôve hit the jackpot! Oak & Onslaught have clawed their way back from the brink, shutting out the Chaos Creatures 2-0 to tie this Grand Finals series at two games apiece! We are going to a Game Five, sports fans! üèüÔ∏è‚ú®

The action was hot and heavy from the opening whistle! **Teria Ravo** scooped up that leather head in Center Field like a hungry wolf, setting the tone for a night of Warden dominance. While the Chaos Creatures tried to muscle their way in, **Abner Seidel** decided he‚Äôd seen enough. He lined up a shot from Center Field and‚ÄîSWISH‚Äîput the Oak up by 2 points early on! It was a beautiful display of precision that silenced the rowdy Monteforte crowd faster than an assassin in the night! üéØ

But a Trollball game isn't just about points; it‚Äôs about the medical bills! **Millham Evangeline** decided Raouf Dragone‚Äôs trident was looking a little too heavy and sent them to the sidelines with a tackle that rattled the graffiti right off the stadium walls! The healers were sprinting out before the dust even settled. You love to see that kind of dedication to the craft of carnage! üöë

The Monteforte squad tried to respond, but their passing game was as shaky as the scaffolding they play on! **Tucker Hett** launched a wild pass that was snatched right out of the air by **Normi Glaudia**! Interception! It‚Äôs like the Chaos Creatures were playing with greased palms, probably too much of that hot gravy if you ask me! ü¶¥

As the first half wound down, it turned into a literal demolition derby. **Normi Glaudia**, despite the boots being on the wrong feet, absolutely flattened **Urata Oriana**! I haven't seen someone hit the dirt that hard since **Lord Orzalon** dropped his favorite soul-jar! Then **Millham Evangeline** went back for seconds, injuring **Alben Diantha** just to make sure the healers didn't get bored. üè•

Just before the halftime whistle, **Teria Ravo** decided to join the party, leveling **Fogel Raynold** with a tackle that probably made **Sir Randy**'s fancy bow string snap in sympathy. The Chaos Creatures were dropping like flies in a plague-house! By the time they limped into the tunnels for the break, the home crowd was more hostile than a warlock at a tax audit! üç∫

Halftime didn't slow the Wardens down one bit! The open bar has clearly been working its magic on the spectators, but Oak & Onslaught remained soberly focused on the violence. **Millham Evangeline** must have a personal vendetta against **Fogel Raynold**, because they sent Fogel back to the injury list barely minutes into the second half! Talk about consistency! ‚õìÔ∏è

Chaos finally showed some teeth when **Mouldon Earl** caught **Affra Yanaton** with a vicious tackle, sending the longsword-wielder to the dirt. It was a rare moment of Monteforte glory in a night that mostly belonged to the visitors. I‚Äôm sure **Colm** and the White Ravens are looking at this wreckage and wondering where it all went wrong for their local boys! üê¶‚Äç‚¨õ

The ground was slick, the crowd was throwing more than just insults, and the players were starting to look like they‚Äôd spent too much time at **Imra's** dust shop. **Symer Crissy** tried to put the game away with a late shot, but it sailed wide. It didn't matter though, because the Chaos Creatures couldn't mount an attack if their lives depended on it! üöÆ

**Gabriele Klehm** finished the game clutching the ball in the Away Field, looking like she‚Äôd just been through a meat grinder‚Äîwhich, to be fair, she had! The final whistle blew with the score still 2-0. The series is tied, the momentum is a mess, and we are headed to a winner-take-all Game Five! üèÜ

So, there you have it, folks! The "heroes" live to fight another day, and the Monteforte rebels have to find a way to stop the bleeding before the next match! My demon heart is pining for the tie-breaker! Will it be the Wardens' law or the Creatures' chaos? Join us next time for more blood, more beer, and more TROLLBALL! This is Nok the Corrupter, signing off! ü§òüî•
